title: [Large-Scale] Sustainability Argumentation Development Workshop: Discussion-Based Approach for Strengthening Social Decision-Making Competency

context.prior_knowledge: Basic sustainability concepts understanding, organizational decision-making experience, social stakeholder analysis, and foundational public policy knowledge
context.additional_context: Aimed at elementary education administrators, this course strengthens decision-making competencies for sustainability within corporate environments, utilizing digital devices for real-time collaborative settings. It particularly emphasizes institutional social responsibility (CSR) and the capacity to design community-linked projects.

learning_goals: Learners can present logical arguments across economic, environmental, and social dimensions using three or more argumentation structures in sustainability-related social conflict scenarios.
Learners can systematically compare and evaluate the pros and cons of sustainability alternatives using the Target-Mat tool and make decisions considering stakeholder coordination.

Learners can enhance critical reflection skills on sustainability policy definition and decision-making processes through collaborative discussions with peers and explore citizen-participatory solutions.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
